countriesFaq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
countriesFaq.description: Learn how places are added, how the data is managed, and how you can contribute to the Bitcoin map.

questions.question: How are places added to the map?
questions.answer: We use public data from OpenStreetMap and direct contributions from the community. If you know a place that accepts Bitcoin but isn't listed, you can add it manually.

questions.question: What is OpenStreetMap?
questions.answer: OpenStreetMap is a collaborative project that creates open, editable maps. We use their data as a primary source to identify Bitcoin-accepting places.

questions.question: How can I see all available places?
questions.answer: Explore our interactive map to find places by city, country, category, or features like Lightning support.

questions.question: How do you ensure the data is accurate?
questions.answer: We filter and enrich OpenStreetMap data, and allow users to suggest changes or leave reviews. Every new place goes through a moderation process before it appears on the map.

questions.question: Where can I find the code for this project?
questions.answer: The entire project is open source. We'll publish the repository soon. View the repository.
